result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arielle D Turner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Arielle D Turner in court with Attorney Adam J. Schleis.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is dismissed and read-in for Defendant's plea to Case #14CM1751.

Defendant Arielle D Turner in court with Attorney Sam Benedict for Attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Benedict requests an adjournment so that a new public defender can be assigned to this case.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Arielle D Turner in court with Attorney Nicole Masnica for Attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Masnica requests an adjournment so Defendant can accept state's offer.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Arielle D Turner in court with Attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Christine Bohn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mitchell requests an adjournment.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Arielle D Turner in court, in custody, with attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Defendant allowed a free phone call to obtain bail
  Hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
